alert.note: Alert for Cheatham (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 5:48AM CST until February 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs affecting Cheatham County. For the Harpeth River...including Kingston Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Portions of Mound Creek Road become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 17.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 21.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 03/29/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
